values:
michael is transitioning from two jobs (teaching and counseling) that he has worked at for 2.5 years:

you build your world one day at a time.  sometimes, you stand awash in misery, confusion, and apathy.  Isn't the present so utterly charming?  sometimes, it just doesn't make any fucking sense at all.  An alarm clock sounds the conscious stream of sensation and you build on, because there is only one way to go, right?  Even with that being known and obvious, sometimes you root yourself into a fogged landscape of better days that glimmer and shine into the distant horizon.  You dig your feet deep in lost love and missed chances that blur at the edges but are so real and unquestionable at their core.  You contort your body with aching joints to see over your shoulder of what once was, but it remains just at the periphery.  Sometimes, you cast a net blindly forward and hope to tangle that fleeting mass of fulfillment and joy, a joy that could only be felt if you had the right net to catch it.  You never seem to.  Nets and roots, and the fucking present.  

for some reason, disorder or dysfunction, or utter coincidence.  for some flaw in character or protective pattern, i love the way i fit with people.  and in the recent memory, i am realizing that i deserve it.  i build it.  it is deliberate.  it is cared for with great big concepts of self, mighty monoliths of value, undefined and fluid, but bound by my being. i get to see people everyday who are so brave and wise, who are taking life one day at a time and making sense of it, giving worth and value to it.  i get to witness their greatest moments of self-care and revelation, of cracking cemented structures of concept and belief.  i get to see the world shape around them and their changing forms. i get to see the world flourish despite all of its natural restrictions.  and i get to see it because i stand here to receive it.  it is deliberate.  

and they will find all that life is and I can no longer ride along.  I can no longer hold that moment with them.  and i will miss them.  and i'm so grateful

Her husband pees sitting down, and has been for a while.  A man who pees sitting down... is your response a pause?  is it a gasp?  peeing... what is a normal way to pee...  and her husband shits standing up. and here I am standing over a bowl, splish splash, off target, on target, off target, no hands.  i call it relief and i'm grateful.

it starts right then at that moment when the foot touches down.  and from the curvature of the heal, the vibrations, zaps, those connecting sparks merge and mold and fan out in all directions... one burning star at its base, one quake at its foundation, one muscle spasm, one newly born lifeform setting forth in all directions.

i havent been writing at all... and i like to write. 

we stress ourselves out.  im stressed just thinking about it.  there it is, this wide expanse of choices and decisions and we build walls so high.  im suffocating in my own situation.  borders spread further away.  the state line takes a gallon of gas to reach.  home is a place of order and career paths, of important upcoming dates and lists. invisible offspring sopping at the table in spaghetti sauce.  of plumbing, oil checks, quilted patterns in grass...  damn.  the other day she told me that i should pursue writing.  you know?  pursue.  i never even considered it.  writing is one of those hobbies you do when you lay in bed with the journal spread out under a lamp, back aching, pen bleeding on the sheets.  its ideas in the head that you cant scratch down because there is no paper around.  anyway, i love her for suggesting it.  the question:  what am i going to do with the rest of my life?  really, though.  what are we doing to ourselves?

im reading 
i know this much is true by wally lamb.  900 pages... im on 650 and the main character still hasnt gotten a break... dont you love it?

dont read.  this is vulgar and deals with poop... lots of poop talk in the entry... warning. warning.  

before we talk about doodie, id like to announce to me, myself, and i that i have completed the seven book series by stephen king, called the dark tower series.  it was quite a voyage and i recommend it... at least to number 4...  okay, try reading number 1, the gunslinger, and then tell me what you think.  after that, it has its ups and downs, some of it is not so good.    

an excerpt from an email to a dear friend under the profound realm of trust and confidence. 


i just got my poop stool checked... meaning i had to go into the hospital bathroom, squat over the floor, and let out the curly ol tootsie roll of a smelly poop drop into an upturned cup... then after pinching it off at the right amount, like an artic circle icecream dispenser, i had to put the top on, put it in a paper bag, put it in a plastic bag, tie the top... and all set.  but damn, taking that thing out and presenting it to the lady in labcoat behind the desk... number 84, room stacked shoulder to shoulder full, i swear something had crawled up my ass and died there... that smell made my eyes water.  the only moment i felt embarrassed of carrying around my own shit... having to release the odor in the company of 50 people.  i made a joke at getting my poop test results... 5 doctors have scrutinized and have argued and have finally agreed... my poop stinks... it stinks mighty fine.  i swear ive been having happy stools, those ones that last for a while, solid, dense, no breakage, just a fine ol slippery log, sliding like butter, like a train on tracks of grease, tires on oil, just plopping on down like a diver on his silver medal moment.  yep... but not today my friend.  i cant tell you in 250 words, even though i may be approaching that number, how tricky my feces were today... they were slick little bastards embarrassing me like that.

i dont know.  someone asked me why do we have to grow up.  i saw xmen, number three, and everyone who knows me, knows that i might have talked a little in the theater.  just a little... there are some that say... no, shut up and watch the movie, let the only thought process be, blink... popcorn... sip... burp... a little drool on the corner of the mouth... blink... chew... see, im from the old school, those days in which a director was dependant on the honest feedback of the audience.  those were the days, tomatoes hitting target, boos, chants, getting up and stomping out, making a scene, creating an uproar.  because those were the days when people had the poetic license to say, this sucks ass.  do you know what i mean?  in other words, if a director delivers poop on screen, i have a right to say something... dont i?  im coming off strong, and i know i get out of hand, and i do try to control myself out of the molded model of courtesy and respect for others... but sometimes, i think its a crime to sit awe struck at garbage... its a big ol poop cycle, in and out.  i look around at the images casting hues on the whites of eyes... blink... chew... burp... mmmm... more salt... burp... blink.  and what have we lost through film.  i love film... i love going to the movies.  thats what i have to say... im annoyed at annoying my fellow movie neighbors.  those that turn off thought process and watch the pretty lights for an hour and half.  okay okay... done. 

long days and pleasant nights.
i think waves should flow into my feet, rush between the toes, brim over, sending those small hairs afloat.  its one of those sensations to know before death comes a knocking.

i dont know what woke me up, but once glued eyes pealed open, hazed vision focused about in the night(im so dependrnt on corrective eyewear that without them i would probably lose my entire gene pool in a matter of days).  when i turned over i saw the landscape of a naked back with fingers drawn over and scratching one of those itches that can always use help from a second party.  so i pushed the hand away and began to do some curls and circles with my nails, pressing against the skin. if i remember correctly, even after i had thoroughly completed my task i set my hand on the waste, palm spread out just below the hip bone.  this is when two thoughts came to mind... i dont recall in which order.  

1.  the curvature of nicoles waste has flattened out noticeably.

2.  its so nice that nicole could be here with kenny and i.... whether it wished and washed its way into my thoughts first is of no matter, because this is the one that lingered, flashed, brought by breath to stop and my eyes to widen in the darkness.  and with the spark of realization, nicole was no where to be found.  i had been caressing the back and waste of my 17 year old garifuna brother, kenny.  we had been sharing the bed the for the past few nights during our travels.  i laughed outloud, woke him up, explained myself clearly through my snorting. he had no idea, and come to think of it, seemed completely content to have a good back scratch, not a sound, not a bit of resistance.    

my eyes play tricks on me.  always have.  its just gets complicated when innocent bystanders get involved.    

-----------------------------------------------

im really enjoying a book by john steinbeck called travels with charley.  a light read that is easy to carry around.  i think it has been a favorite... the actual book has character too... released in the early 60s, cover torn off, pages yellowed with softened corners.  anyway, if you can get ahold of it, take a look-e-see.

sometimes i can just watch the grains of sand falling, and if i stick my hand out to block the downpoor, it only makes me realize how little control i have over it all.  like a rock resting on a shoreline, it is overwhelmed, left hopeless, and washed away. 

how is everyone?  i have had a headcold for the last week and when i think im better, the next morning blesses with me with a huge wad of snot lodged in my throat, oozing from my nostrils, missing the kleenex, and stringing joyously from the fingertips like green vines draped in a rainforest.  i dont mean to be gross, im keeping my digits thoroughly cleansed, but lordy, where the hell is it all coming from.  

ive been going to a catholic church in town.  and even though i filter through the structured messages and slow numbing of the minds through brainwashing, i find it rewarding.  i have been reading lectures from the bible in front of the people, standing at certain times, sitting at the right times, sometimes even saying an amen.  but, what really floats my boat, is the singing.  it is the only access to live music that i have.  they sing in spanish and in garifuna and when we stand, hand in hand, and sway like trees in the wind, i feel a certain peace.  and i think of it is as a time to dedicate to thinking of other people, those that vanish when the touchable life takes priority.  i guess its a form of prayer, concentrating my thoughts on one individual and hoping for the best.  becomes clear to me how dear and important they are to me. 

im not going to get carried away in love talk.  its nice though.  how easy that is written.  its nice to smile before a door is opened, to think of someone between pages of a book, to have an arm draped over my chest and have it become a part of it.  i cant say how i feel about being in a framed human form.  sometimes, i can touchdown with fingertips and let the nerve endings search out curves, bumps, moles, scars.  i can feel the pupil enlarging with incoming light, the lenses focusing, the lids refusing to shut.  and in the movements, skin follicles rise and fall, hair is brushed aside and the molecules fly, and i can do nothing but breathe it in.  but, then... its all contained in five fingers, four flailing limbs, surrounded by layers of skin, glued together by bone and ligament... and i just want to step out of my shell and know her.  i guess we figure a human spirit to exist when we think of love, how the body connects us to all that physical world, that sensational input... but to believe there is something living behind or beyond the pulsing of blood, the division of cells, the conversion of energy, the firing of neurotransmitters,  something that only love can bring to life.  now... that is where human being can be a lost or an enlightened soul.  either way, its beautiful.

"get thee back to the aroma of birth," dr. robbins had told the countess, "for the smells of the female body, the smells you have sought to kill with your totalitarian chemicals, are the very smells of birth, the strong odors of the essence of existence.  the nose that is offended by the hot perfume of the cunt is a nose unsuited for this world, and should be sniffing gold on the scrubbed streets of heaven.  the vagina reeks of life and love and the infinite et cetera.  o vagina!  your salty incense, your mushroom moon musk, your deep waves of clam honey breaking against the cold steel of civilization: vagina, draw our noses to the grindstone of ecstasy, and let us die smelling as we did when we were born!"

tom robbins, even cowgirls get the blues.

-----------------------------------------------------


happy new year to everyone!  michael is going about his business in usual fashion.  staying plenty busy and still finding time to strum and doodle and daydream.

christmas project:  the brains of the operation: nicole.  donations:  provided by the good folk of jutiapa, north coast, honduras.  free help:  michael, pc volunteer, and representative of spudville, idaho.  we finally got through with the project of december a few days ago.  to paint the final picture, we loaded clothing for every variation of human shape and form, age, width, height, bags of assorted food, soap and toothbrushes, and little gadgets and toys for the younglings.  we drove in the back of a flatbed truck, standing, over the potholed streets to a village outside of nueva armenia (my site for those who havent got a clue)  we unloaded the goods into the one room, one lightbulb, mud sealed school and had each mother of the community came through with a sack and filled in 5 articles of clothing for each family member.  about 20 mothers left weighed down by new clothing.  by the end of the event, there was time to exchange smiles, kids were running about in the night, and nicole pulled it off... im not going to bore you with all that was involved to get to this point, but we pulled it off.

i have more to say... i do.  i hope everyone reading this and everyone linked personally to those reading this are fine and dandy.  there are some volunteers who document their stories to a fine tee, and i leave random bullshits here and there... kind of vague of what the hell is going on, but i think im giving the general jist of it all.

public question... requesting feedback...

what makes a good kisser... in other words, what made that kiss that sticks out in your memory a good one?

does teeth clanking together mean passion?  

does the tongue always need to get involved?

why does a good kiss always lead to humping with or without clothing...?  


merry christmas!

smiles stretch too wide, i see too much white.  stares piercing from behind... and then look away.  there are moments when i want to sit under the corner street light, right on the curb and crush rocks with my stare.  i dont want to be seen.  i want to curse at the dogs bark, and rave and rant, and the night will listen and soak it all up like a sponge.  it will take the bad and the ugly, the rottenness of my words, of my being and expose it to no one.  it evaporates... just like that, a smoke ring spiraling to particles.  i will brood in the shadows of my contorted face, cracks cast down in elongated black streaks.  and if i cry, the tears will be left unnoticed... if i feel like scratching the heavens with flailing clenched fists, it will do no harm.  

im just tired of smiling.

the stuff that keeps me sane...

without the little ones around, i dont know what i would do.  and there are so many of them.  sometimes i think to myself that im about ready to have kids of my own, little hobbit like creatures running around my ankles... then i walk into the house to make a surprise visit.  wilmer goes ape shit and breathes in all heavy, bouncing around like a released top from a string... and little pollo(chicken) starts shouting my name like a skipping record.  the show has just begun.  i sit down to talk with nilda (mom figure) as pollo crawls on me, sits on my lap, crawls down, jumps up, blows his snot all down the front of my shirt, jumps off, i still believe it was on purpose.  i just think to say an ooohhh... like one of those baby panda bear documentaries and the cuteness is just to much to self contain.  then pollo grabs a broom and threatens to hit his brother with the stick, treating it like a pool stick... hes 2 and half... so it looks quite awkward... so of course, he pokes his brothers eye with the end of it.  and wilmer starts sobbing and then the mom stands up in action, and yells something i dont understand.  the panda bear special continues to unfold as pollo squats and pee rolls down his leg onto his moms sandals in a water fountain stream.  well... i dont know what else can happen other then more beating of the brother with 2 liter coke bottles with the soundtrack of screaming and yelling... the mother seemingly zoning out with a meditative temple rub with the points of the fingers.  shes still smiling though when i say goodnight, and pollo is kind enough to slam the door behind me, echoing throughout the neighborhood.  at least, he wished me a goodnight and said see you tomorrow.  and let me tell you what, i cant even wait.

i like it how the path to my house is covered with jagged rocks dug deep in the pits of the earth, surrounded by sharply set grains of sand, bristly blades of barb and grass, the suctioned stickiness of sour mud, slivers of sticks, twisted twigs, battered and bent branches, powdered over with pointed edged plastics and the random rusted tipped nail.  i especially like when night sets, and even starlight cant penetrate through the cloud cover, and how a handful of youth always seem to forget their sandals beneath my dinnertable.  they dont even take a second thought to turn back over their shoulder and call for them.  theyll walk all along night itself and sleep under the day barefoot and completely content while i scratch a shallow sore on the softened surface of my sole with annoyed displeasure.  
 

-------------------------------

that was what made traveling appeal to him- he always made new friends, and he didnt need to spend all his time with them.  when someone sees the same people everyday, they wind up becoming a part of that persons life.  and then they want the person to change.  if someone isnt what others want them to be, the others become angry. everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, and none about his or her own.

paulo coelho, from the illustrated alchemist

its thanksgiving, volunteers in the west are gathering in a 3 bedroom home as a group of 30 and they are bringing along a live turkey.  some of those ol crazy outdoor types are going to kill it in the shower and prepare it then and there.  on the north coast we got other plans, mainly revolving around board games.    

happy thanksgiving to everyone. nanc. ktab. shlong.  i have alot on my mind... but i think ive caught something in the air and my mind is all bubbling and my arms are chilled with porcupine quills standing straight up... last night i was forced to wear two shirts and the only two sheets i own... and i was still cold, the fetal position just isnt tight enough.  i feel like sleeping.  im yawning in the presence of interesting company and my face is melting into some heavy set mask of irritation... 

i guess all that warm fuzziness that im sensing from the states is having its effect.  sounds like some of my favorite people are just miserable.  damn holiday season.  why does the hype, amped up commercial billboard three dimensional cutouts, waxed cheeks and bleached grins, claustrophobic malls and gaudy lit creations of greens and reds and cotton stuffiness have such a negative effect on us.  if i was there, i would sit with my sister, my ma, mr. goode, while the dogs act as heat blankets and noise makers, and artificial lighting brings colors to the faces over hot beverages.  sitting on my roost, the piano bench, i would be able to see everyone in the room, and id wrap my scarf tight around my neck, and just to spice things up, i would whip it off into the air and let it hover toward my sister (mainly for her reaction), teasing her like casting a fly to an awaiting trout, watching particles and hairs dislodge after months of hibernation and float about like lifted dust.  i would laugh, and wait for my mas fudge, and lick the spoon till i could see my upside down distorted face in its mirrored surface.  yep, its the holiday season folks!  so deal with it and enjoy  for godsake... thats me getting all spiritual and all that jazz!  amen!

david came to the door completely naked, shivering and dripping to the tips.  i wrapped that 6 year old in a towel and asked what the hell he was doing running around naked... he said he was bathing.  like when i was a kid running through the gutter, making dams out of pinecones and sticks, i fashioned him one of those homemade raincoats out of a black garbage bag.  he popped his arms through those holes like they were on springs, and the neck caught on his swelled up smiling cheeks.

when david left the house again, he could step straight down from my door and dip his toes 5 inches below its frame into water.  in fact, my house and all those in the town were completely immersed in it.  the rain came in the night, and it hit hard upon the tin, crashing down, and when those drops stuck together in streaks, and began to bead up in pools, the current caught ahold and carried it toward the sea, through the trees and directly along either side of my home... or its what i could account for from my front window.  so much water passed by.  i took up the habit of stepping out, unzipping, and releasing the full bladder in a fine stream toward its wake.

say adios to the garden idea.  i had to wade out in knee deep waters, bending over into its muddy face to search with my hands for the tipped over flower pots.  i saved 4... beat and bent and looking up at me saying... what the hell took you so long?  on the third day the sun peeked through and i opened the door wide open to invite it in, setting the plants in a tight group, huddled together and spreading out in its warmth like lizards on granite.  i got some sun on my pallid shoulders and waved at the boats from my book... ass sat on my floor, feet out in the cool wetness.  the neighbors came close enough for me to notice them looking at my nipples.  ha... i havent exposed them much in site.  i realized how sensitive i am to eyecontact and the weather... how every change of tide or temperature, moon out and about, or a settled dull grayness can manipulate my mood on an hourly basis.  tease the mind, fuck with the vision.

so im really getting into this teaching role.  something about getting 4 brand new sticks of chalk, wiping the dust all over the front of my pants.  pacing left and right... changing the voice to make the lesson that much more interesting.  writing, erasing... name calling is fun.  handing out papers, walking the isles to make sure no one is copying is hilarious.  he he... i had gotten through my lesson and i said... okay, lets go... and all 15 or so of em just sat there looking at me, their notebooks open, pencils pointed down and ready to scratch something.  i said... okay, im leaving, times up... were done... and they didnt budge.  i couldnt help but smile openly when they yelled in unison that they wanted more homework... mas tarea, they yelled.  got to give them what they want, you know?

i was strumming a silly tune to myself under the burning of a single light bulb the other night... doing the cool down, getting ready for bed process, tapping a beat with my feet... when i got divebombed by a bat, flapping around in a black streak.  my room is a small space for two humans let alone a sporadic, flying mammal.  i did the first manly thing i could think of... i took a leap and covered myself under that mosquito net ive gotten so attached to, watching it from below and the shadows cast about like a vulture over its prey.  and what next... i call up the nearest friend and breathe into the phone... what do i do?  she suggested swatting it with a broom like a fly, and i said (pardon the language), fuck no, have you seen how ugly these things are up close!....  bats are cool creatures, though, huh?  i mean, ive always respected them, eating bugs and stuff, but i have this strange fear that they are going to slap and stick themselves to my face or neck and give me one of those hickeys that wont go away for weeks.  kind of erotic and terrifying at the same time.

speaking of erotic, heading toward the workplace around the neighborhood in a horse shoe shaped bend, a woman called out to me in garifuna.  im learning the language at a slow pace... things like good morning, how are you, im okay, im hungry, im going to bed, delicious, what is your name... stuff like that ive got under my belt.  but i have not heard this short saying that she was shouting... wue te.  i thought she was saying wait... practicing some english with me, so i smiled and said... ae... garifuna for yes.  she approached laughing outloud, with her head back doing one of those eeeee high pitched sounds the women and myself (these days) make when something is funny. i said, what does that mean with my innocent country prepubescent boy face... and she got near and said it means youve got the biggest penis.  you learn new forms of greeting everyday here.

The preacher sighed. "I'll go anyways," he said. "Somepin's happening. I went up an' looked, an' the houses is all empty, an' the lan' is empty, an' this whole country is empty.  I can't stay here no more, I got to go where the folks is goin'.  I'll work in the fiel's, an' maybe I'll be happy."
     "An' you ain't gonna preach?" Tom asked. 
     "I ain't gonna preach."
     "An' you ain't gonna baptize?" Ma asked.
     "I ain't gonna baptize.  I'm gonna work in the fiel's, in the green fiel's, an' I'm gonna be near to folks.  I ain't gonna try to teach 'em nothin'.  I'm gonna try to learn.  Gonna learn why the folks walks in the grass, gonna hear 'em talk, gonna hear 'em sing.  Gonna listen to kids eatin mush.  Gonna hear husban an wife a-poundin' the mattress in the night.  Gonna eat with 'em an' learn."  His eyes were wet and shining.  "Gonna lay in the grass, open an' honest with anybody that'll have me.  Gonna cuss an' swear an' hear the poetry of folks talkin'.  All that's holy, all that's what I didn' undertan'.  All them things is the good things."
     Ma said, "A-men."


the grapes of wrath, by john steinbeck

good lord.  we got hit with some rain.  after it stopped coming down in a constant sheet for almost 5 days, i hopped in a pick up truck and headed for home.  the road was destroyed, rocks and tree branches clogging the roadway, new outlets of water cutting perpendicular valleys, a clear glass lake formed in all directions for about 300 yards of the trek, water coming up over the hood of the truck.  and there was my little house, standing in a puddle, dripping on the edges, my garden mush and mud.  i slipped in, everything musty but dry enough.  i took off all my clothes, slipping on a white cotton t and socks, longs pants, shirt, and shoes and strummed on the guitar for a good 2 hours.  i wasnt thinking of anything else other than that damn guitar.  i wasnt thinking about not having water in town for a week, about the fact that the rainy season is just beginning.  hell, i dont want to think about it now.

i guess its passed by.

stacked books, collected spices, packed bags, cluttered clothing.  curling steam from a tall glass of coffee, kind of like cartoon smoke.  shes addicted.  a pendant hanging from a silver chain that ive noticed around her neck since first seeing her.  a photo book with the last 10 months, she giggles with me from the other room as i remember outloud.  just laughter, no talking really.  she gets out from bathing, walks around the room looking for something, leaving damp footprints on the white tile.  i watch her.  i see softness on her naked back, curving lines that only women can capture, towel falling low on the waste. her black hair slides down from the shoulder in currents until the tips touch the bottom of her spine.  i sit until shes slipped those used socks up to the middle of her leg, and i smile slightly when she looks down on me.  i dont know if its built up to this moment... the random music, the chain between my fingers, the coffee smell, but im hugging her before the first tear falls... and it lasts and passes us by.  

one of my favorites just left for atlanta, packed bags, one way ticket, and i have memories more vivid than photographs.  shes promised to keep in touch.

i like this paragraph...

forty three years old, and the war occurred half a lifetime ago,  and yet the remembering makes it now.  and sometimes remembering will lead to a story, which makes it forever.  thats what stories are for.  stories are for joining the past to the future.  stories are for those late hours in the night when you cant remember how you got from where you were to where you are.  stories are for eternity, when memory is erased, when there is nothing to remember except the story.

the things they carried, by tim obrien 

----------------------------------------


why does it have to hit like a storm?  i want to watch the drops turn to drips, dust lifted up in puffs, ripples reaching out.  but this overwhelming madness, taking cover with arms upraised, feeling it come down at all angles.  ive never known how to respond.  ill wait until the clouds clear, the dampness on hairs end dries, the blades of grass to uplift their faces again, and then ill say if i can truly call this a crush or not.

im in one of those places where the world pulls in all directions... around every corner there is someone calling, needing, asking, and im getting to the point where i want to say, shut up, im busy.  i want to shake something (except a freshly baked baby right out of the oven) and yell.  im not losing it, im smiling at passerbyes. shit, in just 5 minutes im going next door and having the special soup of the day... the soup of everyday... beef, and im going to flirt with the waitresses and talk about the weather.. the weather of everyday... hot and rainy.  giggle about stupid shit.  its what loosens the load, huh?  chunks of beef floating in salty water, fighting the buzzing of flies, and giggling at nonsense, complete and utter nothingness.  ah... maybe a coca cola too, to wash all that bullshit down the hatch. ahhh... refreshing.

wrapped in a mosquito net, i watched the firefly try to escape between the cracks.  after 7 months im still living without any sort of cooking device... forks and sharp pointy objects, and frying pans, and rubbermaid seal topped containers.  im pinching my pennies.  but the other day i couldnt resist dropping about 10 bucks on a package of glow in the dark stars.  the stove can wait.  i stuck those stars all along the inside of my mosquito net in random constellations, and when night set, i laid on my back with my arms folded on my chest, one crisp sheet up to my stomach.  i found that they just werent working... dim even in darkness.  so i got my flashlight and set its beam against each individually placed star one time through, 10 seconds each... two times, 5 seconds each... third times a charm.  and after 10 minutes i sat beneath the stars and traced shapes, legends, and gods as the shooting star fire flies streaked across the sky.

i was thinking to myself about the impact of random people.  i mean, if i flip back a bit in time and let the memories flash in a blur, capturing freeze framed snap shots, i see these really vivid characters, people in my past who left an imprint deep in the lining of my person.  im talking, for example, about the woman inviting me in to clean her hotel room at the cottontree inn.  raccoon thick eyelashes, and thickly pasted foundation on this little rolled over woman sitting in her seat, beaming.  and as i tucked her sheets around the edges she carried on about the importance of shoes, about the profound connection between the feet and the mind, posture, balance, composure, respiration... all related to the proper footwear.  i had been bitching about my shoes, going home with sore soles, an aching arch... she changed my life... he he... im rambling, but i just find it strange how you can think about people who have stayed around for months or years at a time throughout the lifetime and even though you think highly of them and smile at the mention of their name or relationship, they just dont appear like that old woman, a moment doesnt stick, a quote or dialogue doesnt spark.  they are just there.  what makes those few float forever in the front of the mind, those few that change the line of sight, point of view, faced directions.  i was wrapped in a mosquito net and thinking to myself.  

quote.

in the early morning in huancayo i missed the things he might have hated about us- the wide highways lined with doughnut shops, the fat cars, the endless entertainment, the unspectacular, unheroic, grandly petty life of prosperity and wraparound comfort.  life on the road was spare and beautiful, full of clarity and delight, but when i roused myself at dawn in huancayo i could not help but consider the last chance i would have to turn around from all this.   

  chasing che

i think my phone number is 

011 504 919 9368

if you have a honduras map.... join with me here.  i start at 6.30 in the morning travel from nueva armenia (northcoast beneath los cayos cochinos, between la ceiba and trujillo, north of jutiapa) to la ceiba in bus.  i take another bus from la ceiba directly west to the second largest city of san pedro sula.  i take a bus from s.b.s. south to santa barbara (next to the lake de yojoa).  i catch a ride in the back of a pick up truck to the interstate, where i hail a bus to guama.  from guama i hitch a lift in a small bus to pena blanca, after which another vehicle takes me to las vegas.... okay... that is about 10 hours of traveling and about 2 inches of map.  yep, thats right, i didnt take the most efficient route and i am late for my workshop, not knowing where it is, i diddle daddle on the computer for a bit.  thanks for listening... and if youre bored, get a map!  fun times to be had by all!

i just dont understand sometimes.  i wasnt expecting it.  i never saw it coming.

nilda left for the states a week ago.  hoping to cross the border illegally between mexico and texas and heading in the direction of new york where an aunt awaits her arrival.  she didnt say anything to anyone, only to emelina who was left with nildas cell phone, industrial size fan, and three children, wilmer of 8 years, nilsia of 6, and pollito of 2.  and that is the shocker.  she was such a good mother.  they would lean on her, embrace her, giggle uncontrollably in her grip... they were obedient and respectful in her presence... she attended to the scratches on their knees, the fever on their foreheads, the emptiness in their stomaches.  and now pollito asks emelina where his mom is, all three of them expecting her return the day after tomorrow, always tomorrow... shes coming tomorrow.  i dont know if ill see nilda again while im here in honduras, which is another 2 years.  i watch them over my dinner playing with toy cellphones, dancing around to imaginary drums, getting ready for the mornings classes. i lose my appetite, laying in bed, wide-eyed in darkness, trying to understand... and after a blink, i sleep it off.

okay... im out of the loop...

can someone tell me what our president and his administration have done in the wake of katrina?  i have heard shattered stories of people in assisted living drowning after being unable to escape for 3-4 days... i have heard that there was a project along the water front that has been in the workings for a long while, but still waiting on funding, could not serve the city in blocking some of the water... i heard the president and his administration were all on vacation, rice being seen shopping for shoes 3 days after the hurricane arrived in nyc... now... this obviously sounds biased, alot of liberal minds over her, so if there is anything else i need to know about, im really interested in hearing your findings, opinions, whatever else.  thanks.  im going to do some browsing for a bit.

a fellow volunteer was going about her business, walking the dusted streets for corner shop groceries, weaving in and out of the crowds.  something caught her eye on a passing tshirt, something that reminded her of home.  on second glance, she noticed that someone was wearing a shirt from her highschool back in the states, and even on closer inspection, on the long list of printed font on the back, she located her name amongst all the other graduates of 1998.  i find the size and the tight interactive network of the world amazing at times.  this story made me stop in my tracks, gape mouthed, and awe struck. 

karen turned 29 yesterday.  everyone happened to be together in siguatapeque.  about 30 or so from the health project and about 25 from water and sanitation.  she sat in a chair on the stage as the speakers blared a beat and about 35 individuals took turns giving her a mock strip tease lap dance.  the 65 year old married couple bent their asses to and fro, kissing her on the cheek, and blushing all the while.  others sat right on her shaking their breasts in her face.  a 23 yearold put his hands on the floor and backed up onto her, his legs wrapped around her waist.  i watched as some young gals would go out in trio formation, dancing around her on all sides.  another guy stripped off his shirt, tossed it over her head, and pulled her face slowly to his crotch.  when the line faded, and had begun to spiral around her of those who had already strutted their shit, i got in line, backed my ass into the center of the stage to the beat, turned toward her, continued my jig over her lap, pulled her up from her seat, hugged her and told her how much we loved her.  her husband was the last spreading her legs while he stooped low, ending with a passionate kiss and tight embrace, as we finally all rushed upon them and pressed together, yelling happy birthdays into everyones ears.  i was left feeling the flushed cheeks of rum and coke, pleasantly warmed by the company and thinking to myself how i cant remember a better way to celebrate a birth.

oh man... i can not tell you all how nice it is to have a new bed!!  and this is what i call a bed!  what is the one that is just a bit bigger than a double?  matrimonial? ... yeah, that one.  thats what ive been waiting 5 solid months to get my hands upon... now... i wake up all spread out like a spider on its web, with enough space to dodge the druel, and not crush those bottle thick glasses that have been placed to one side... now, if something slithers, crawls, or flies on my legs or arms... all i have to do is reach up to the far corner (my storage space) and grab one of my two trusty flashlights to see what the hell is going on... hmmmmm... que rico!!!  you know, i feel so alive!!!  and rested!!!  i dont even feel like writing anything else as nothing would even compare... one more small step to comfort.   

hey clay... hope this entry may have been persuasive in your own ventures.  he he he....!

im growing a garden right outside my bedroom window.  even now, if i extend my hand through the panes of glass ill touch the fabric of foliage, feeling the buds open up right inside my palm.  ill pick it for my one true love.  she giggles just on the other side, her flirtations fading in chase.  i have yet to see her.  in the morning rays i trace her tracks in spinning circles, toiling the soil with the tips of her toes, a once ripened fruit missing from a low hanging limb, softened seeds strewn at random.  i look up from the veins of a freshly fallen leaf to watch her dance to the rhythm of swaying shadows, the breeze through branches, leaves lifted and left alone.  there is work to be done.  my knees crack at getting up and i use the trees trunk for balance.  i would bathe and bask here all day if i didnt know that the garden was the only thing that kept her coming back.

okay... question to throw out there to anyone with some spare seconds.  there is a gal of 13 years who urinates everytime she falls asleep, even if she is sitting upon a chair at a party and just dozes off for a second.  everynight, she sleeps on the concrete floor, a pool of urine flowing about her... everynight. i remember reading something about using some sort of conditioning to stop this behavior (one of those psych classes that my friends gave me shit for)... anyway, does anyone know what course to take?  just curious. remedies... medicine... dream analysis... dr. phil... dr. laura... scientology...?

people are kind of direct here:  i was bouncing around on the bus (still running into people i havent see for over a month as they popped into a nearby seat or wobbled past through the narrow aisle.  a young lady about the age of a freshman in college, dressed in business formal, coming off of work in the city sat down by me.  we have been friends and were carrying just fine and dandy... laughing... my spanish was right on.  boom shucka lucka!  anyway, i have been wanting a new bed for so long, sleeping on a 2 inch sponge and a single wire meshing support... so like a friend sharing the stupid stuff on the top of my mind, i say... tomorrow, i buy myself a new bed!!!  im excited!!  and without hesitation she bends over to me and asks "puedo probar tu cama?".... being michael, being a little naive... and emphasis on being michael again, i first thought she was referring to laying on my bed to experience the comfort (you know what i mean? try and test?)  by the way, her statement means... can i try your bed.  she looked at me seriously, voice carrying over to me in a whisper, and then i started repeating the expression in my head... felt like minutes... her expression held in place... pressing the question over and over and click!  light bulb!!  and oh god... she wanted for me to invite her into my new bed!  which means... she wanted to get all fresh and nasty...!!! im joking.  but i played dumb and acted like i didnt understand the context as she began to rub her temples... saying olvidalo (forget it)  it made for a kind of an awkward one hour bus ride home.  i looked at the clouds getting tired of wearing my touristy "i dont know what the hell is going on" face... which usually can get me out of most situations...  most

so, im back in site...

projects and workshops and ideas spinning and sparking in all directions.  my manager wants me to focus on starting a hiv-aids support group, my counterpart wants me to work on the young guys in site, my director has given me some money to work with the trash problem, a neighboring volunteer wants me to get ready for a possible scholarship arrival for some of the kids in the school system and a rise in tourism opportunity for the cayos cochinos... it seems that alot of people have brought nueva armenia (my site) into the foreground, which is good for everyone... and im just trying to get my feet on solid ground... floating ideas for flower gardens, english classes, a clean soccer field, puppet shows... and finishing this blasted harry potter series... he starting to date and i cant put the bloody book down. 

i guess when you are coming off of mommas cooking, looking over a plate of tortillas and beans, fried wieners, and eggs just doesnt settle very well.  and then i begin thinking... this month im going to get things into shape!!!! seriously... im going to buy a bed...a bookshelf... im going to get that 5 inch gaping gap between my roof and cement walls blocked from the inpoor of mosquitos, frogs, and 8 legged friends... my grass is out of hand, almost to my knees.  my life needs some discipline!!! 

hmmmm... 

i dont know where i am right now... its all kind of overwhelming... i know it will settle to some comfortable level that makes sense, but transitions are hard, and this one just doesnt seem smoother than the first go at it.  

thanks to burnt pizza and talkative jelly fish heads, cool pitchers and good breaks, garlic breath, falling jenga, flustered cheeked monopoly, free ribs, ripped music, pocatello climate, fallen feathered paddle ball, snot smeared front windows, homemade doggy doors, triple flavored snowcones, cat induced allergies, midnight talks... but most of all, to seeing everyone, everyone looking so full of color and life, so beautifully lit up, to be able to see and hug gretchen on her daughters wedding reception.

a friend named g. brought up a heated argument she had with her new husband over circumcision.  her vote was no, his vote was yes... she then proceeded to say she was never going to have kids with him.  

i know this is random..., but give me your own vote on circumcision and a reason why or why not.  if you ever plan on having your own offspring, there is a chance of having a boy, therefore leading up to the life changing decision of clipping that foreskin... that means everyone who browses or skims over this live journal, let's have an opinion.

there is something quite intimate about being bare assed on a bed.  having a dozen random faces pop in and out, awful jokes over finding the perfect vein, being wheeled around bandaged faces, rolled back eyes, sagging shapes leaning in any which direction.  i put all my clothes in the plastic baggie, tied up with a string, and answered all the same questions.  nope, i dont have an std.  yep, im a lush and an addict.  i think about loneliness as a faroff figure approaching waxed floors, sliding doors, white walls, metal clipped curtains pulled open, coming from afar to say a hello.  i yawn out of nervousness... the concept of tubing and wires in my mouth, my arms, sprouting from my chest, exiting the urethra.  i can taste the change of air, the pressure over my lips and nose, breathing it right in just as they say.  removed glasses, blurred vision, men passing my name about casually as if we were old college buddies.  flourescent lighting, rolling over onto new tables, movement of gowns surrounded by a stiffened silence.  these drugs are strong they say... and i blink off, not even time to vocalize one sound before i believe them.

so, heres the plan stan... im to take that good ol 8.5hour bus ride to the capital, where ill be flown to washington dc... this sunday... up and at em the next morning for my appointment to have surgery... who the hell knows whats going on.  they call this morning in my site, washing my clothes in a basin, planning my english class, getting ready for the yearly town fair for tomorrow, and they tell me about an appointment monday morning in the states.  i was just getting pumped to shake the booty all night long to drums and alot of sweat.  ah... shucks.

tell me, someone... where are anne and andy?  where are their comments?  are they lost in the flames of fire?  are they swamped in the rush of discounted returns?  are they flying from the nest?  are they watching silly romantic thrillers?  are they making noises through the ventilation system?  is she smiling?  is he pasting another sticker on an empty space?  is her child running wild in the yard?  is he proudly petting his big toe?  anyone who has news or word of the going ons of anne and andy... short stories worth sharing... their general temperaments... their latest plans... please post them now.  im feeling neglected as a big brother and im seaking your help.  boohoo me. 

two days ago... was the 24th birthday of a dearest friend.  and all though i may be older by a whole month and 2 days, i have never allowed myself to be condescending to his youth and innocence, to my 32 more days of experiential growth.  i have always remained humble at his questions about life, his inquisitions about the changing of seasons, passing philosophies on trivial matters.  i have allowed him to grow on his own, discovering his first steps, always ready to reach out a steady hand to a wobbling toddler.  on the 16th of july, my dear friend turn the ripening age of 24, and even though im not there to lend my wisdom and advice of 24 years and one month and 2 days, i am confident that he is self sufficient, self sustaining, self assured... even at this tender age, this tender time.  but i worry so... i remember when i was freshly released into my first week of being 24, seems like only yesterday...  walking awkwardly to and fro... touching new terrain with the tips of toes.  ah... the worries and woes.  i must assure myself that my teachings and training will guide him on his crusade, will brighten even the darkest, deepest droughts of despair.  that myself as a model may stand as a statue of strength during the bleakest of times.  to an old friend, i send out my love... send out all that i can share... 

happy birthday cs.  ha ha ha... i miss you.

while im researching the question addressed in the last womens group over hiv/aids, i want some feedback, scientific, humorous, or otherwise.  

can a person trasmit hiv by swallowing the semen or vaginal fluid during oral sex?  im talking within the stomach.  i know that if someone has a open sore or bloody wound inside the mouth... there is reason for high risk... but ingesting the fluids?...  

so let me know what you think.  im interested.

so my latino friend, named jose hermando, brought over a penis he carved from wood.  he prides himself on his craftsmanship, usually carving snakes and fish from chunks of wood.  so, my host brother of african descent, named marvin, went to get his wooden penis from his house... which turned out to be strikingly larger than that of our mutual latino friend.  so there we were, three men, three races discussing the girth and size of the average penis by passing around wooden dongs.  marvin even said that the 7 inch long shaft that he brought over was too small...  we wont tell him this, but his mom says otherwise... we then proceeded to undertake condom demonstration, each of them taking more than enough turns to unsheath the rubber, blow out the tip, and gently slide it down the wooden rod... marvin, a conservative christian 27 yearold, even told us how to put a condom on by only using the mouth... tricks of the trade he is sharing for reasons still unknown to me, educational purposes well say.  after sharing 2 liters of sprite, and some bags of chips, the group dispersed, jose with aspirations to carve a matching vagina for the complete set, marvin off to show condom demonstrations to the more sexually active 13 yearolds, and myself with a handful of hilarious photos.

i want us to take a moment... to sit back from our computers... just a moment.  all together now.  look at your kneecaps, notice the curvature of the bones, placed together perfectly for bending... bend your knee... pet your knee while bending it (good time to whisper or sing a happy song too).  ah... thats right, just like that.  think about how much your knee has done for you, how much it has allowed you to see and do, sitting there holding your legs together without thanks, without thought... in this moment of togetherness, ourselves with our knees, lets realize how fucking important they are!

everything is getting figured out... but i just had my knee drained again of the fluid, a clear yellow, hot fluid that makes it impossible to bend or walk comfortably.  i traveled via bus for 9 hours to come to headquarters, to be close to the doctors who speak english, and i got poked again, 3 cute nurses hovering, got pushed around in a wheelchair for a littel while, fun times... ive been set up with a hotel, they are doing some tests, and everything is going to work out.  im optimistic.  they will send those results to washington to wait for the next step.

last tuesday just so you all know:

i woke up, prepared some hiv, aids questions for the meeting at 9 am... always procrastinating.  i went to the healthcenter to help and mainly sit in on the meeting of 30 people in the community.  about half way through, when the conversation was getting heated on the topic of the machismo, 3 other volunteers from 3 surrounding areas suprised me with a visit and a gift back of suckers, crackers, and COOKIES (oreos even).  so, they sat in on my questions and when i thought the meeting was over... my counterpart said something to me that i didnt understand, all faces turned toward me, and the room became silent... so, confused, i stood up and went down the one aisle and remained standing in front of everyone.  6 people took turns singing to me, face to face, with arms waving and the group harmonizing, 6 different songs in garifuna and spanish... raining me with hugs and kisses on the cheeks.  finally, when the cheering slowed it had come to my big performance... a request for a song.  my voice still hides at such moments so i quickly rebounded and offered to dance the punta... they began to slap the arms of their plastic chairs to give me a beat, and i slowly turned, grabbing near my crotch, shaking the hips to the beat... after 30 seconds i was at the other end of the aisle, people cheering, which completely climaxed when i slowly bent my knees and shook my butt near a womans face... there was a outcry of laughter and howlers... they absolutely loved it.  and i only say that because it was true.

it was just like any other night, really.  i set up the fan, removed the floating frog from my waterbasin, swatted the cochroach with a roll of paper, laid back to sleep to the calling of bugs and toads, watching the trapped fireflies from beneath my mosquito net.


about 1 am, i awoke to a small animal crawling over my bare stomach... thinking it was another damn cochroach, i unwrapped myself from my net and single sheet, catching souls of feet on cold, uncertain concrete... i clicked on the light and turned to find... a rat, scrambling and clawing to escape from the net.  in other words, yeah... i chased that leaping, jumping, scurring son of a bitch around for about an hour... never having killed a mammal with flesh and a skeletal system, i finally followed him out of the front door... in shoes and underwear.  


went to bed like anyother night.. just interrupted a little by a large rodent.

if you think about michael in the real world... that of driving the 1986 cheverolet celebrity (a little rusted, but with style) down the strip of yellowstone on his way to geraldines or budget, running on gas fumes, and blaring some tunes... take that image of michael... and place him in a little house, cement walls... in the middle of a small community on the coast of honduras.

the guys think my hands are weak from lack of wear or tear (i show them my callesed fingertips from hours of guitar play.. but that doesnt impress anyone)... the neighborhood thinks my skin is fragile to the bites of little bugs, the town doesnt know what the hell happened to my knee (what do i tell them... that i walked too much!?).. who is this guy, this michael?  the point... i think theyre right... im a sissy man, huh?  come out and say it!!! do i have any characteristic that stands out as manly... as testosterone filled masculinity... lets me honest... hell, im coming out and saying it!  i worked at a bakery!  i want to learn to knit!!  i cry during commercials... im a sap!  

the point of this rant folks!! is that this boy that left the states.. the guy who got jollies from growing his hair out and painting his nails.. flipping is scarf about like some bloody fashion queen is going to come back a man... and even though my hair is kind of gangly and stringy on my chest... im going to have a chistled form of pure 100 percent male beef to grow it upon... believe me.  no more cute little michael with the nice ass... no more... no more!!! you hear me!!! the time has come to grab those balls and claim myself as a man doing as men doing... BELCH...  raaaaahhhhhh!!!!

..break beer can over my head...

thanks for listening.
bla blah blah blah... spittle... blah...blah........ble bla blu blo... ble bla bla bla boooooooooclikerdoo... boingshucklelucka... dingdangdo....

i had her laughing so hard, tears streaming, face flushed red, a giggling fit at my fingertips.  i was on a roll and i delivered the punches on cue, drumrolls, applause, and all.  she told me i should be a stand up comic, and in that moment i believed her.

my fingers streamed across those strings in a blur of plucks and strums, and my voice reached a range in harmony with all intent.  i was in the flow of fluid musical motion, rhythm, scales, time, and all.  she introduced me as the next Bob Dylan, and in that moment i believed her.

the words poored from the pen, dipping straight from the ink of my open stream of consciousness and precisely pinning down the spinning, spiraling chaos of thought on paper.  i was expressively explosive, emotionally exhausted, with rhyme, stanzas, tenses, and all.  she suggested i write works for publication, and in that moment i believed her.

im a person who giggles at fart jokes, is completely tone deaf, and cant spell to save his life.  and those are the truths i know and life with.  but my mom believes in me.  she is completely and utterly biased, but she does just that.  it is during those moments when i have believed in myself.  on mothers day, i say thankyou, for feeling beautiful in her company, for having substance and structure, direction and inspiration, comfort and confidence, value and reason, from beneath her roof throughout my lifetime... for having her as my mom.

i know this journal entry is over the top and romanticed, but im not going to defend it or explain it... it stands on its own.  i was hesitant to put it out there, but only jesus really cares.  


------------------------------------------------------------------
  

ive got specks of sand outside my window.  little dots floating upon a sea of aqua blues and turquoise greens, waves taking rest upon the softened beaches of white grains and shadowed banks.  pelicans perched upon wooden boats, schools of fish weaving in the shallows my feet, the water clear to all, playing with the sunlight at depths of currents and motion.  

and her i am, the norteamericano, on single specks of the greater globe.  catching a ride, wind whipping through my hair, land masses of palm trees, and dense greens, grasses, mangroves, all contained in the approaching structures of homes and hammocks.  i step foot off of a dock into the base of this boat, jumping from key to key, key to island, strolling through huts and salutations by hand, by voice, by expression.  

there are no burdens of flashing bulbs and fleeing film, no need to articulate what i feel with words and writing.  i cast myself in a foaming salt, around my body, gasping air upon breaking the surface once again.  a bed of water beneath my back, i lay with no effort, blankets flowing over my legs, sheets over my chest.  the voices, a murmuring strength, the wind, a whispering force cut silent when i lay back further, the sea in my ears.  i spin in a current, watching the world from below, clouds pluming in a sky all taking infinite variations of shape and color, shades and tones, to the setting sun.  the way this world moves.  i have no words, just a human body leaving a wake of bubbles and ripples, as the spinning disc, fluid forms, scaly textures, coral reefs, hallowed shells, close the day and invite the moon.  this night we bathe, taking hands upon our slippery skin, grabbing ahold of naked shoulders and stomaches, oily under the weight of contact.  laughter echoing out, splashes, crashing, toppling, running footsteps upon the shores, lit by the full moon, having its way with the clouds and the currents, the foilage from above, mirrored streaks shining white.  

im washing salty stones from between my toes, captured in the follicles of my hiar, fluid from the nostrils, skin parched and bitten... i say thankyou to life, without searching and longing, tourist traps and blind photography.  i have grains of sand just outside my window.  for two years i can dip my fingers along their surface, scratching the bottom, swimmind and immersed.  

as cotton whites hang from lines, fans buzzing in the air, blood filled mosquitos smeared on my forearm, soles rubbed raw and open, burnt cheeks and sweaty bands on my upper lip, i will remember it as a memory with an ongoing life that has just begun.

my address is as follows.... letter for letter... word for word...

okay... there it is.  maybe you should sent tester letters to make sure it works... im kind of a skeptic when it comes to the mailing system here.

i chose to wear my brown corduroy pants this morning... which means, that at 10 am. when im lugging a cumbersome piece of wood across the yard, i literally have a downpoor, a torrent, of concentrated sweat from my face... only my face.  the kind of sweat that flows through my scattered, lame excuse for eyebrows and burns the eyes with a salty force... but, even though you can see the heat radiating from the baking rocks and dust, im surprisingly getting kind of used to it.  its sweat, its natural, and i feel good about being hydrated and healthy and the fact that i can blend in with my neighbor, a 240 lb black woman of 45 years, who embraces me with her own free flowing sweat, sticky on the arms, harbored around the neck, and we can have that cultural exchange... sweat.. uniting nations together one drop at a time.  i have found a community that is not sensitive to pit stains, even on gray tshirts, and i seak shelter in their company at finally finding welcome to those of my kind. 

of course, deodorant is always a nice thing... and toothpaste.

a shit story worth sharing as told by another volunteer:  

so imagine a group of guys sitting around a hotel room competing with one another over passing gas and laughing about it.  the once jovial cachaphony of sound took a wrong turn, however, when a overly excited friend came fresh out of the shower, uncovered his bathrobe, attracting much attention by his curious peers.  he stood over his bed, yelling, listen to this one, and let it rip.  unfortunately, his bowels were not in harmony with his motives, as he took a squat, he pressed out some gas, but also a down poor of diarrhea, all over his bed.  the room was left in a certain confusion and appropriate disgust as this short diatribe ends. 

hey kids... you need to write more!!!  and you know who you are... i think my recieving notes is going to be more of a necessity than a friendly request.  por favor.

yeah.. my subject is misleading.  but it is time to pull out those maps of honduras, get your index finger and your close vision prepped, because i have been given a site...  drum roll... nueva armenia.   if you focus your attention on the north coast between la ceiba and trujillo, youll see my little dot sitting at the mouth of a river, below some spots of islands.  what the hell does this mean?  i have been selected to work with a garifuna population... research that one too, please!!!  which means im going to be learning another language over time, surrounded by seafood, a dance called the punta which orginated from there and is now spreading as most dance trends do.  

the garifunas have the highest rates of aids-hiv in the country, crazy rates, which explains my post.  i will be the first health volunteer there... a population of 1000 people, no internet (25 minute bus ride south), one of the poorest towns on the coast.  HOOOOOOTTTTTT!  so send me handkerchiefs and cool clothes because im going to be melting... i cant tell you how hot it is going to be.  

what else.  ill be living there in 3 weeks.  my vision to fashion a ping pong table, a hammock, some sort of garden with my guitar, straw hat, and sweat.  but ive yet to know my living or furniture situation.  im surrounded by some good friends about 2 hours travel in all directions and plan on working with them.  the others are all over the place as far south as the salvador border as far west as guatamala, but theyve all made requests to come and visit as tourists dont find there way to my site and i literally will have my back yard as the beach... cold beers and red snapper.... but lets be serious, the romance of sunrises and a coastal rendevouz does not ease the fact that i believe myself to be in one of the most difficult situations of the health group.  im not going to tell them that... because i think they all know it.  

by the way... im going to have to buy a cell phone.. duh duh duh.  as i know... know.. know... that i would like to hear your voices more often, which would cost you more than me... he he he.  but yeah.. a fucking cell phone.. the idea sends shivers down my spine... to be alone does even more damage.  

thats the news for now.  send my love.
